choices.A: Export a CSV list of users in the Cisco Webex Control Hub, set the Hybrid Calendar Service to TRUE for users to be enabled, then import the file back to Manage Users menu in the Cisco Webex Control Hub.
choices.D: On the Users tab in the Cisco Webex Control Hub, check the box next to each user who should be enabled, then click the toggle for the Hybrid Calendar service to turn it on.
choices.B: Set up an Auto-Assign template that enables Hybrid Calendar.
choices.E: From Cisco Webex Control Hub, verify the domain that your Hybrid Calendar users will use, which automatically activates them for the service.
choices.C: Select the Hybrid Services settings card in the Cisco Webex Control Hub and import a User Status report that contains only users to be enabled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Adding the Domain doesn't provide any additional features for Hybrid Calendar. Setting up an Auto-Assign License template will ensure all future new users have the service activated.

Selected Answer: AE
2. Click Export to download the file and you can enter user information in a new line in the CSV file.
To assign a service, add TRUE in that service's column, and to exclude a service, add FALSE. 

https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/nz0krq9/Configure-and-manage-your-Webex-Calling-users#task_AF07212F4D2DA8D3F7BF6681552F7EF7

Converted user accounts are not activated automatically if you didn't verify a domain.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/directoryconnector/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins_chapter_0111.pdf

comments.content: All of the answers are in this doc.

discussion.content: A, B and E seem like they're all correct for auto-config.

Selected Answer: AE
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/directoryconnector/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins_chapter_0111.html

Converted user accounts are not activated automatically if you didn't verify a domain. For example, if you turned on the auto-assign license template and then turned on Directory Connector without domain verification, converted users are inactive in the cloud backend until they confirm their email addresses.

Hi guys, 
It actually could be D. I think the actual template referred to in B is Auto-Assign License template. B is omitting the word license. However, this is not the reason I think it may be D.

"Converted user accounts are not activated automatically if you didn't verify a domain. For example, if you turned on the auto-assign license template and then turned on Directory Connector without domain verification, converted users are inactive in the cloud backend until they confirm their email addresses."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/directoryconnector/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins/cmgt_b_directory-connector-guide-admins_chapter_0111.html#concept_B4BB5830508EDCD7C49345AA9D54BD6E

The URL below is referring to the Directory Connector, but a URL that explains the Hybrid Calendar has a hot link that points there:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/calendarservice/cmgt_b_deploy-spark-hybrid-calendar-service/cmgt_b_deploy-spark-hybrid-calendar-service_chapter_0111.html

Selected Answer: AB
Answers are A & B. Validating the domain doesn't add functionality for new users.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been tasked to bulk entitle 200 existing users and ensure all future users are automatically configured for the Webex Hybrid Calendar
Service. Which two options should be used to configure these users? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Configure an Application Account for Message Connector
 Configure an account for Message Connector to access the AXL API of the Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM and Presence Service. You must use an independent administrator account, not the main administrator account. Remember the details of this account so you can enter them in the Message Connector configuration later.

 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/messageservice/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide_chapter_010.html

choices.C: Use an application user not the main administrator account with the ג€Standard AXL API Accessג€ role
choices.A: Add a new end-user with the ג€Standard AXL API Accessג€ role
choices.D: Use the main administrator account if it includes the ג€Standard AXL API Accessג€ role
choices.B: Use an application user with only the ג€Standard CTI Allow Control of All Devicesג€ role

questions.question_text: What is a requirement when configuring the Cisco Webex Hybrid Message account for accessing the API of the Cisco UCM IM and Presence Service?

discussion.content:
lolah is correct. Here's the link:

 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/spark/hybridservices/messageservice/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide/cmgt_b_spark-hybrid-message-deployment-guide_chapter_00.html

D is correct
"You can use Resource Groups in Control Hub to define your organization's geography, and then assign Expressway resources to different resource groups that represent locations.

The set of users you assign to each resource group should correspond to the users in all IM and Presence Service clusters served by the Expressways in those resource groups."

questions.question_text:
The Cisco Webex Hybrid Message service is deployed geographically for separate Cisco Unified IM and Presence clusters. What must be configured in the Cisco
Webex Control Hub to achieve this deployment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A _cisco-uds SRV cannot be included in a _collab-edge SRV record and vice-versa

The following is an example of the _cisco-uds SRV record:
 
 _cisco-uds._tcp.example.com SRV service location:
 priority = 6
 weight = 30
 port = 8443
 svr hostname = cucm3.example.com
_cisco-uds._tcp.example.com SRV service location:
 priority = 2
 weight = 20
 port = 8443
 svr hostname = cucm2.example.com
_cisco-uds._tcp.example.com SRV service location:
 priority = 1
 weight = 5
 port = 8443
 svr hostname = cucm1.example.com
Remove the cisco-uds SRV record for the external DNS.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. When a Jabber user attempts to connect from outside of the organization, the user enters the login information as "user@example.com" and receives the error "Cannot find your services Automatically". The engineer tries to resolve SRV records used by Jabber.
DNS A record "expressway-e.example.com" points to the Expressway-E IP and "cucm.example.com" points to the Cisco Unified Communications Manager.
Which change resolves the DNS problem?

choices.A: Change cisco-uds to point to the Expressway-E FQDN.
choices.B: Change the collab-edge record to point to 5061.
choices.C: Remove the cisco-uds SRV record for the external DNS.
choices.D: Change the priority of the SRV record for cisco-uds.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Prerequisites for Jabber Team Messaging Mode Installation:
-Create user accounts in Unified Communications Manager.
-Create user accounts in Cisco Webex Control Hub.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/12_7/cjab_b_deploy-jabber-team-messaging-mode127/cjab_b_deploy-jabber-team-messaging-mode127_chapter_01.html

questions.question_text: What is one of the user-related prerequisites for Jabber Team Messaging Mode Installation?

choices.D: Create user accounts in Cisco Unified CM and Cisco Webex Control Hub.
choices.A: Create user accounts in Cisco Webex Control Hub only.
choices.C: Create user accounts in Cisco Unified IM and Presence.
choices.B: Create user accounts in Cisco Unified Communications Manager only.
